title: Prompt Architecture Masterclass
description: Test your understanding of prompt structure and architecture.

questions.question: What matters more for effective prompts?

options.text: Using specific 'magic words' and power phrases
The structure and organization of the prompt
The length of the prompt
Emotional language to motivate the AI

questions.explanation: Structure matters more than specific words. A well-organized prompt with clear sections will outperform a messy prompt with 'magic phrases' every time.

questions.question: What are the four layers of the Prompt Stack (in correct order)?

options.text: Context, Instruction, Format, System
System, Context, Instruction, Format
Instruction, System, Context, Format
Format, Context, System, Instruction

questions.explanation: The correct order is: System Prompt (the OS), Context (working memory), Instruction (the command), and Format (output template).

questions.question: Why is the System Prompt compared to an 'Operating System'?

options.text: Because it runs in the background without user awareness
Because it defines fundamental behavior that governs all subsequent interactions
Because it needs to be updated frequently
Because it controls the hardware

questions.explanation: Like an OS that provides the foundation for all applications, the System Prompt defines the fundamental behavior and 'constitution' that governs how the AI responds to all user messages.

questions.question: Which structural pattern is Claude specifically trained to respect?

options.text: JSON objects
Python code blocks
XML-style tags
YAML format

questions.explanation: Claude was specifically trained to respect XML-style tags like <context></context> and <task></task>. This makes XML the most reliable structural pattern for Claude.

questions.question: What is 'prompt injection'?

options.text: A technique to make prompts longer
When untrusted input tricks the prompt into doing something unintended
A method to inject code into the AI model
Adding examples to improve prompt quality

questions.explanation: Prompt injection occurs when malicious or untrusted user input contains instructions that override your prompt's intended behavior. It's similar to SQL injection in web security.

questions.question: What is the simplest defense against prompt injection?

options.text: Using longer prompts
Adding more rules to the system prompt
Wrapping user input in delimiters and treating it as data
Limiting user input length

questions.explanation: The simplest defense is to wrap user input in clear delimiters (like triple quotes or XML tags) and explicitly tell the model to treat everything inside as literal data, not instructions.

questions.question: Why should you keep the four prompt layers clearly separated?

options.text: It makes the prompt look more professional
The AI charges less for structured prompts
It reduces ambiguity and helps the model parse your intent correctly
Separated layers run faster

questions.explanation: When you mix system prompt, context, and instructions in one messy paragraph, the model has to guess what's what. Clear separation reduces ambiguity and improves consistency.
